Summary Passionate, dynamic and result orientation with IT professional, over 5 years' varies sales jobs as Channel Account Manager covered many provinces' business at Intel, such as Guangxi, Hainan, Yunnan, Guizhou, Hunan, Hubei and Shenzhen, with rich front line/account sales and team management experience.  
 
Proven track record of driving sales out for direct customers, e.g. LOEM, MNC, distributors; Driving end user direct engagement in key segment, e.g. I-café, SMB; Built brand preference among retail market to win MSS.  
 
As manager to recruit, educate, organize region sales team. I not only love technology, but also thrill to motivate others to share my zeal. 
 
Fluent in English, Mandarin and self-learning Japanese now. Experience Channel Account Manager Intel Corporation May 2012  – Present (3 years 4 months) Wuhan, Hubei, China Manage the relationship between Intel and customers. Identify and develop new opportunities at region PC market. Establish and cultivate relationships with key individuals and nurture relationships as well as educate our fellow travelers (distributors, vendors, OEMs, MNCs, etc) in support of accounts.  
 
- Responsible for Hunan/Hubei PC, tablet, and smart phone sales, which include Lenovo, Asus, Dell, Acer, HP, Samsung, Hasee, Sony and Toshiba.  
- Leading team to build up channel structure, 73 prefecture/county level cities, 235 channels and 485 stores developed to ensure a healthy business growth. 
- Hunan/Hubei notebook, 2in1, tablet market share all become NO.1 in east region so far. Core market share increased 18% which leading region growth. 
- As manager to recruit, organize Hunan and Hubei 10 people’s sales team.  
- Strategic thinking on new business development, e.g. leading channels entry into SMB market with windows’ tablet through experience store solution. 
- Drive 485 retail stores product on shelf, exposure, recommendation; channel PM and retail sales person product training and seasonal marketing campaign. Channel Account Manager Intel Corporation January 2011  –  April 2012  (1 year 4 months) Kunming, Yunnan, China I take accountability for developing the maximum business with channels over both short term and long term. Help to develop a clear understanding of Intel's roadmaps, goals, strategies, and business practices, including pricing, forecasting, terms and conditions, and distribution. Communicate strategies to appropriate field and factory personnel to inspire their required support and coordination. Increasing channel preference for Intel architectures. Meeting or exceeding assigned annual billings.  
 
- Responsible for Yunnan and Guizhou box CPU sales. Develop cooperation with stakeholders which include Gigabyte, Asus, MSI, Nvidia and AOC. 
- Grow region consumption revenue with 20+ cities, 100+ distributors and 200+ stores through strengthening core business, identifying new business ventures.  
- Improve Guiyang DIY market share by 20%, growth rate is NO.1 in south region at 2011-2012. Kunming market share up to 72%, top of region. High-end sku market share increased 10%+ both in Guiyang/Kunming, leading region growth. 
- Driving business with innovative sales tools, e.g. “Sales Bible” “Owners’ Voice” “Tell the Truth”. Increase customer’s value through new usage model, e.g. “SSD”.  
- As sales manager to hire, train, educate Yunnan/Guizhou 7 persons sales team. Channel Account Manager Intel Corporation March 2010  –  December 2010  (10 months) Nanning, Guangxi, China - Responsible for Guangxi and Hainan provinces box CPU, OEM and i-café sales. Also temporarily covered Shenzhen/Chaoshan area as sales manager. 
- Establish channel structure, lead 6 persons sales team grow customers’ value by help them go into SMB, i-café business and expansion to emerging market. Intern Bain & Company July 2008  –  December 2008  (6 months) Shenzhen, Guangdong, China A bank customer satisfaction project. As group leader of the intern team for this project. Key Accomplishments 
 
Local business indicator 
GT2 mix had obviously progress during whole year and final result of Nov is 16.14%, much higher than country level (14.86%). I5+mix are increasing from 16.77% to 31.56% in one year. 
 
Retail coverage 
Successfully covered over retail 430 stores, usually over-achieve I5+ POR in every quarter.  
Store performance had big improvement that pass rate increased to 82% at end of the year. 
XOEM Channel pass rate is the No.1 among EC region.  
 
Program execution and training 
Quick acting and executing central programs and well monitor to whole process; like ASUS GT2 hurdle program, my territory worked as the No.1 district; 
Focus on training, my team always to be the No.1 to train more RSP on each training segment. Except central material, I had helped to general other useful training materials and tools and sharing with team.  
 
MM China supporting 
Fully support to MM China business and smoothly goes with them for every quarter’s CRA process running. Developer engagement through every function, from C-level executives to programmers, artists and producers. Business models including Freemium, IAP, premium download, streaming, cloud, retail, licensing, bundling, online, and vertical marketplaces. Experience with and contribution to many departments including marketing, sales, engineering, product development, support, PR, investor relations, executive management, company strategy, QA, customer service, and community management. Extensive global business experience in Asia and Europe. Comfortable in Fortune 100 companies through startups, as an individual contributor, management and team member. 
 
I must be passionate about the company and product, and be able to deliver clear value and win-win solutions to the developers. Integrity is core to my developer engagements, building trust and helping them succeed.
